body.p:
To His excellency
The Govenor of Kentucky

Your petitioner Patrick Kellar would respectfully represent, that at the Oct term 1856 of the Bourbon Circuit Court, Andrew Moraraity was indicted for a misdemeanor; and a bench warrant issued for his arrest -- Your petitioner became his bail in the sum of one hundred dollars -- Said Morarraity failed to appear to answer said indictment, and by the usual proceedings judgment was rendered against your petitioner for the amount of said bond at the July Oct term 1857 of said Court and execution issued thereon in Nov following -- without effect -- Recently another execution has issued and is in the hands of the sheriff of Bourbon County.

Your petitioner states that he is a poor man, dependant on his daily labor for the support of a large family, consisting of a wife and ten children -- all of the latter are dependant upon him for support except the eldest, a son who is now serving in the Federal Army in the 4th Ky Infantry --

Your petitioner cannot pay said sum without, bringing distress upon
upon his family --
Whilst, said sum is in the eyes of many, small; it is to one in the circumstances of your petitioner a large one --
Your petitioner, believing that his case is one proper for Executive Clemency, prays that so much of said bond may be remitted as the law will permit --
Patr Kellar says he believes the statements of this petition are true --
Patrick Keller
Sworn to before me by Patt Kellar this 29 apl 1865 --

Att R. J. Brown Examr.
Bourbon County Ky

The affiants Jno Brown, and John Kennally state, they are acquainted with Patr. Kellar who made the foregoing petition & affidavit, and his family & their circumstances and the statements made in regard thereto, in said petition are
correct & true --
Att R J Brown

John Browne
John ^his X mark^ Kennally
Sworn to before me by Jno Brown & Jno Kennally this 29 april 1865

Att: R. J. Brown Examr.
Bourbon County

Bourbon Co
vs
Patrick Kellar
$1.00
3d May/65
Mr Page asst. secy
If remitted let me know & I will send fee or send papers & I will inclose fee
R J Brown

Remitted
Richard T. Jacob
Lt. & act. Gov
